Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Do we have an ac_param or a param to create smartchains with merge mining ?
When a block of a sha coin with huge difficulty is found on a pool with merged mining enabled, all coins with merge mining on sha with lower difficulty will have a block. The merged mined coins accept as valid the hash of the coin with higher difficulty. Merge mining is also fun (on doge: <https://github.com/dogecoin/dogecoin/search?l=C%2B%2B&q=merge+mining>)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: there are many coins with merged mining (but mostly on sha and scrypt). But I heard only about GLT on equihash (<https://github.com/globaltoken/globaltoken/blob/master/src/rpc/mining.cpp#L1416>)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I think that such an ac_param doesn't exist. We discussed merge mining few months ago. Merge mining can be an added value to have blocks with a nearly 0 cost (see explanation above) so less risk of stalled chains. But any attack on merged mined coins have also a 0 cost. Dpow with merge mining can be good then.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: merge mining ü§¢

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Merge mining + AdaptivePoW

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Seems would work well

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: And DPoW of course too

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`Merge mining + AdaptivePoW`
seems even sillier that mergeming to me
I never understood the appeal of mergeming, other than "free" income from garbage chains that miners wouldn't otherwise even touch

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Piggybacking hashrate off a more popular coin has its merits for small chains.  Merge Mining has been used to diff stall a chain before so that‚Äôs why I added APoW

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: If a chain has enough merit to mine than diff stalls should be rare, if ever

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I agree,Still gotta be prepared for the rare though ,  it‚Äôs a non negligible probability scenario .   A major pool suddenly discontinuing merge mining during a period of unusually increased hashrate with the auxpow chain having a crappy DAA could cause a stall.    But your point about merit is correct, if the chain is worthwhile it will survive until the difficulty corrects itself with dedicated miners.  Just not a confidence builder for those relying on a somewhat stable transaction processing.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mergemining requires a block header change and a fair amount of work. it doesnt really add much value when we already have dPoW and aPoW

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: That and Verus is already pursuing that route.  No need to reinvent the wheel, too much on our plate already
